intro: Linaria tristis subsp. pectinata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with two lips, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Linaria tristis subsp. pectinata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
